moves.1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. e5: The advance variation of the caro-kann
moves.9. Qd3 Qa5+ 10. c3 Qa6 11. Qf3 Ne7 12. B: Exchanging the Bishop, which has no other squares
moves.13. Qxg3 Nf5 14. Qf2 Qd3: The Black queen has penetrated White's position.
moves.15. Bd2 Qc2 16. O-O Qxb2: Now White either loses a rook or a knight.
moves.17. g4 Nh4 18. f5: Threatening to open the f-file and attacking the f7 weakness
moves.18... gxf5 19. Bg5 Qxa1 20. Bxh4: Black has won the exchange plus 2 pawns.
moves.20... g6 21. Bf6 Rh7 22. gxf5 gxf5 23. Q: Black's Queen is trapped and Na3 is threatened.
moves.23... Rh3: The only move to avoid losing the Queen. Now, if Na3, then simply ... Qxc3.
moves.24. Bg5 Na6 25. Kg2 Rh5: White should play Na3 now. After ... Rxg5+; Kf2 ... Qxf1+; Kxf1, it's Queen and Knight vs. 2 Rooks and Knight
moves.26... Kd7 27. Na3 Rg8+: If Kf2, then ... Rxh2+, which wins the rook on f1 after Kf3 ... Qxf1+
